collectors.title: Database
collectors.titleDetails: (21 total Queries, 21 of them unique across 1 Connection)

queries.sql: SELECT * FROM `tbl_position` WHERE `posID` = '1'

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p><b>Identifying the contract</b></p>\r\n<p>Ensure that the client has appropriately identified the contracts with customers in accordance with IFRS 15.9. </p>', '', '', '', '2.13.2 O2-1', '2.13.2 O2-1', '32', 'Active', '2024-04-10 14:08:25')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>For two or more contracts entered into with the same customer at or near the same time, review whether these should be accounted for as a single contract per IFRS 15.17.</p>', '', '', '', '2.13.2 O2-1', '2.13.2 O2-1', '32', 'Active', '2024-04-10 14:08:25')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Ensure that any contract modifications have been appropriately dealt with.</p>\r\n<i>See IFRS 15.18 – 21 for further detail.</i>', '', '', '', '2.13.2 O2-1', '2.13.2 O2-1', '32', 'Active', '2024-04-10 14:08:25')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p><b>Performance obligations See IFRS 15.22 – 45 for further detail.</b></p>\r\n<p>For each contract, ensure that the client has identified the performance obligations.</p>', '', '', '', '2.13.2 O2-1', '2.13.2 O2-1', '32', 'Active', '2024-04-10 14:08:25')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>If the performance obligations are settled over time, review the methods used for measuring progress towards satisfaction of those performance obligations and ensure that the revenue is recognised in line with those performance obligations.</p>', '', '', '', '2.13.2 O2-1', '2.13.2 O2-1', '32', 'Active', '2024-04-10 14:08:25')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p><b>Determining the transaction price</b></p>\r\n<p>Where there are contracts that include variable consideration, ensure this has been appropriately accounted for.</p>\r\n<i>See IFRS 15.50 – 59 for guidance.</i>', '', '', '', '2.13.2 O2-1', '2.13.2 O2-1', '32', 'Active', '2024-04-10 14:08:25')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Where the entity makes sales with a right of return, ensure that revenue is only recognised for the amount of consideration which the entity expects to be entitled to. </p>\r\n<i>NB: Where consideration is received but the entity does not expect to be entitled to such amounts, this should be recognised as a refund liability.</i>\r\n<i>See IFRS 15.B20 – 27 for guidance</i>', '', '', '', '2.13.2 O2-1', '2.13.2 O2-1', '32', 'Active', '2024-04-10 14:08:25')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Where the contract has a significant financing component (e.g it is paid for over a period of more than 12 months), ensure that, where material, the promised amount of consideration has been adjusted for the effects of the time value of money.</p>\r\n<i>See IFRS 15, Illustrative examples 26-30 for guidance.</i>', '', '', '', '2.13.2 O2-1', '2.13.2 O2-1', '32', 'Active', '2024-04-10 14:08:25')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>If there is any non-cash consideration or consideration payable to the customer, ensure these have been appropriately treated.</p>', '', '', '', '2.13.2 O2-1', '2.13.2 O2-1', '32', 'Active', '2024-04-10 14:08:25')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p><b>Allocating the transaction price</b></p> <p>The transaction price should be allocated to each performance obligation on a relative stand-alone selling price basis unless:</p> <ul> <li>A discount is received by the customer for purchasing a bundle of goods or services; or</li> <li>There is variable consideration.</li> </ul> <p>Ensure that discounts and variable consideration have been treated appropriately.</p>', '', '', '', '2.13.2 O2-1', '2.13.2 O2-1', '32', 'Active', '2024-04-10 14:08:25')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p><b>Recognising the revenue</b></p> <p>Revenue should be recognised in accordance with the satisfaction of the performance obligations in the contract. </p> <p>However, if a contract does not meet the criteria of IFRS 15.9, ensure that revenue has only been recognised when either:</p> <ul> <li>The entity has no remaining obligations to transfer goods or services to the customer and all, or substantially all, of the consideration promised by the customer has been received by the entity and is non-refundable; or</li> <li>The contract has been terminated and the consideration received from the customer is non-refundable.</li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.13.2 O2-1', '2.13.2 O2-1', '32', 'Active', '2024-04-10 14:08:25')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p><b>Contract costs</b></p>\r\n<p>12. Ensure that incremental costs of obtaining a contract have only been recognised as an asset if the entity expects to recover those costs.</p>', '', '', '', '2.13.2 O2-1', '2.13.2 O2-1', '32', 'Active', '2024-04-10 14:08:25')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Ensure that costs incurred to fulfil a contract are only recognised as an asset if:</p> <ul> <li>The costs relate directly to a contract (see IFRS 15.97) that can be specifically identified;</li> <li>The costs generate or enhance resources of the entity that will be used in satisfying performance obligations in the future; and</li> <li>The costs are expected to be recovered. </li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.13.2 O2-1', '2.13.2 O2-1', '32', 'Active', '2024-04-10 14:08:25')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p> IFRS 15 is applied using one of the following two methods: </p> <ol type=\"a\"> <li>) The “retrospective” method: apply the Standard retrospectively to each prior reporting period presented in accordance with IAS 8 <i>Accounting i Policies, Changes in Accounting Estimates and Errors</i> , subject to the expedients in paragraph IFRS 15.C5; or</li> <li>) The “cumulative effect” method: retrospectively with the cumulative effect of initially applying IFRS 15 recognised as an adjustment to the opening balance of retained earnings (or other component of equity, as appropriate) of the annual reporting period that includes the date of initial application. The entity may elect to apply IFRS 15 retrospectively only to contracts that are not completed contracts at the date of initial application.</li> </ol> <p><i>The date of initial application is the start of the reporting period in which an entity first applies this Standard (i.e. 1 January 2018 for a 31 December 2018 year end);</i></p> <p><b>Confirm which transition method is being used:</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.13.2 O2-1', '2.13.2 O2-1', '32', 'Active', '2024-04-10 14:08:25')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Ensure that the transition to IFRS 15 has been appropriately dealt with in accordance with Appendix C of IFRS 15.</p>', '', '', '', '2.13.2 O2-1', '2.13.2 O2-1', '32', 'Active', '2024-04-10 14:08:25')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Ensure that any practical expedients taken advantage of (as set out in Appendix C of IFRS 15) have been appropriately applied.</p>', '', '', '', '2.13.2 O2-1', '2.13.2 O2-1', '32', 'Active', '2024-04-10 14:08:25')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Obtain a reconciliation that shows the impact of first-time adoption of IFRS 15. This should include:</p> <ul> <li>Narrative explanation of how the first-time adoption has been treated (i.e. full retrospective application or the “cumulative effect” approach);</li> <li>Narrative explanation of the changes made on first time adoption (e.g. accounting for refund liabilities);</li> <li><b><u>If the retrospective method has been used: </u></b> <p>For the preceding period, an analysis of each line item in the financial statements affected by the change, showing:</p> <ul> <li>The figure as originally stated under IAS 18/ IAS 11;</li> <li>Any reclassification adjustments made (e.g. showing contract assets separately);</li> <li>Any remeasurement changes from applying the IFRS 15 requirements;</li> <li>The restated figure under IFRS 15.</li> <li>The restated figure under IFRS 15.</li> </ul> <p><i>(NB: IFRS 15.C4 states that the entity is only required to give this disclosure for the comparative period, but may wish to do so for earlier periods and/or the current period)</i></p> </li> <li><b><u>If the cumulative effect method has been used: </u></b> <p>For the current period, an analysis of the amount by which each financial statement line item is affected by the application of this IFRS 15 as compared to IAS 11, IAS 18 and related Interpretations that were in effect before the change; and an explanation of the reasons for the significant changes. </p> <p>A reconciliation of opening retained earnings should be also be obtained. </p> </li> </ul> ', '', '', '', '2.13.2 O2-1', '2.13.2 O2-1', '32', 'Active', '2024-04-10 14:08:25')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Obtain a breakdown of revenue disaggregated into categories that depict how the nature, amount, timing and uncertainty if revenue and cash flows are affected by economic factors. </p> <p>These categories may include:</p> <ul> <li>type of good or service (for example, major product lines);</li> <li>geographical region (for example, country or region);</li> <li>market or type of customer (for example, government and non-government customers);</li> <li>type of contract (for example, fixed-price and time-and-materials contracts);</li> <li>contract duration (for example, short-term and long-term contracts);</li> <li>timing of transfer of goods or services (for example, revenue from goods or services transferred to customers at a point in time and revenue from goods or services transferred over time); and</li> <li>sales channels (for example, goods sold directly to consumers and goods sold through intermediaries)</li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.13.2 O2-1', '2.13.2 O2-1', '32', 'Active', '2024-04-10 14:08:25')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>', '', '', '', '2.13.2 O2-1', '2.13.2 O2-1', '32', 'Active', '2024-04-10 14:08:25')

post.question:
Array
(
    [0] => <p><b>Identifying the contract</b></p>
<p>Ensure that the client has appropriately identified the contracts with customers in accordance with IFRS 15.9. </p>
    [1] => <p>For two or more contracts entered into with the same customer at or near the same time, review whether these should be accounted for as a single contract per IFRS 15.17.</p>
    [2] => <p>Ensure that any contract modifications have been appropriately dealt with.</p>
<i>See IFRS 15.18 – 21 for further detail.</i>
    [3] => <p><b>Performance obligations See IFRS 15.22 – 45 for further detail.</b></p>
<p>For each contract, ensure that the client has identified the performance obligations.</p>
    [4] => <p>If the performance obligations are settled over time, review the methods used for measuring progress towards satisfaction of those performance obligations and ensure that the revenue is recognised in line with those performance obligations.</p>
    [5] => <p><b>Determining the transaction price</b></p>
<p>Where there are contracts that include variable consideration, ensure this has been appropriately accounted for.</p>
<i>See IFRS 15.50 – 59 for guidance.</i>
    [6] => <p>Where the entity makes sales with a right of return, ensure that revenue is only recognised for the amount of consideration which the entity expects to be entitled to. </p>
<i>NB: Where consideration is received but the entity does not expect to be entitled to such amounts, this should be recognised as a refund liability.</i>
<i>See IFRS 15.B20 – 27 for guidance</i>
    [7] => <p>Where the contract has a significant financing component (e.g it is paid for over a period of more than 12 months), ensure that, where material, the promised amount of consideration has been adjusted for the effects of the time value of money.</p>
<i>See IFRS 15, Illustrative examples 26-30 for guidance.</i>
    [8] => <p>If there is any non-cash consideration or consideration payable to the customer, ensure these have been appropriately treated.</p>
    [9] => <p><b>Allocating the transaction price</b></p>
<p>The transaction price should be allocated to each performance obligation on a relative stand-alone selling price basis unless:</p>
<ul>
    <li>A discount is received by the customer for purchasing a bundle of goods or services; or</li>
    <li>There is variable consideration.</li>
</ul>
<p>Ensure that discounts and variable consideration have been treated appropriately.</p>
    [10] => <p><b>Recognising the revenue</b></p>
<p>Revenue should be recognised in accordance with the satisfaction of the performance obligations in the contract. </p>
<p>However, if a contract does not meet the criteria of IFRS 15.9, ensure that revenue has only been recognised when either:</p>
<ul>
    <li>The entity has no remaining obligations to transfer goods or services to the customer and all, or substantially all, of the consideration promised by the customer has been received by the entity and is non-refundable; or</li>
    <li>The contract has been terminated and the consideration received from the customer is non-refundable.</li>
</ul>
    [11] => <p><b>Contract costs</b></p>
<p>12.	Ensure that incremental costs of obtaining a contract have only been recognised as an asset if the entity expects to recover those costs.</p>
    [12] => <p>Ensure that costs incurred to fulfil a contract are only recognised as an asset if:</p>
<ul>
    <li>The costs relate directly to a contract (see IFRS 15.97) that can be specifically identified;</li>
    <li>The costs generate or enhance resources of the entity that will be used in satisfying performance obligations in the future; and</li>
    <li>The costs are expected to be recovered. </li>
</ul>
    [13] => <p> IFRS 15 is applied using one of the following two methods: </p>
<ol type="a">
    <li>) The “retrospective” method: apply the Standard retrospectively to each prior reporting period presented in accordance with IAS 8 <i>Accounting i Policies, Changes in Accounting Estimates and Errors</i> , subject to the expedients in paragraph IFRS 15.C5; or</li>
    <li>) The “cumulative effect” method: retrospectively with the cumulative effect of initially applying IFRS 15 recognised as an adjustment to the opening balance of retained earnings (or other component of equity, as appropriate) of the annual reporting period that includes the date of initial application. The entity may elect to apply IFRS 15 retrospectively only to contracts that are not completed contracts at the date of initial application.</li>
</ol>
<p><i>The date of initial application is the start of the reporting period in which an entity first applies this Standard (i.e. 1 January 2018 for a 31 December 2018 year end);</i></p>
<p><b>Confirm which transition method is being used:</b></p>
    [14] => <p>Ensure that the transition to IFRS 15 has been appropriately dealt with in accordance with Appendix C of IFRS 15.</p>
    [15] => <p>Ensure that any practical expedients taken advantage of (as set out in Appendix C of IFRS 15) have been appropriately applied.</p>
    [16] => <p>Obtain a reconciliation that shows the impact of first-time adoption of IFRS 15. This should include:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Narrative explanation of how the first-time adoption has been treated (i.e. full retrospective application or the “cumulative effect” approach);</li>
    <li>Narrative explanation of the changes made on first time adoption (e.g. accounting for refund liabilities);</li>
    <li><b><u>If the retrospective method has been used: </u></b>
        <p>For the preceding period, an analysis of each line item in the financial statements affected by the change, showing:</p>
        <ul>
            <li>The figure as originally stated under IAS 18/ IAS 11;</li>
            <li>Any reclassification adjustments made (e.g. showing contract assets separately);</li>
            <li>Any remeasurement changes from applying the IFRS 15 requirements;</li>
            <li>The restated figure under IFRS 15.</li> 
            <li>The restated figure under IFRS 15.</li>
        </ul>
        <p><i>(NB: IFRS 15.C4 states that the entity is only required to give this disclosure for the comparative period, but may wish to do so for earlier periods and/or the current period)</i></p>
    </li>
    <li><b><u>If the cumulative effect method has been used: </u></b>
        <p>For the current period, an analysis of the amount by which each financial statement line item is affected by the application of this IFRS 15 as compared to IAS 11, IAS 18 and related Interpretations that were in effect before the change; and an explanation of the reasons for the significant changes. </p>
        <p>A reconciliation of opening retained earnings should be also be obtained.  </p>
    </li>
</ul>

    [17] => <p>Obtain a breakdown of revenue disaggregated into categories that depict how the nature, amount, timing and uncertainty if revenue and cash flows are affected by economic factors. </p>
<p>These categories may include:</p>
<ul>
    <li>type of good or service (for example, major product lines);</li>
    <li>geographical region (for example, country or region);</li>
    <li>market or type of customer (for example, government and non-government customers);</li>
    <li>type of contract (for example, fixed-price and time-and-materials contracts);</li>
    <li>contract duration (for example, short-term and long-term contracts);</li>
    <li>timing of transfer of goods or services (for example, revenue from goods or services transferred to customers at a point in time and revenue from goods or services transferred over time); and</li>
    <li>sales channels (for example, goods sold directly to consumers and goods sold through intermediaries)</li>
</ul>
    [18] => <p>List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>
)
